title: The Intelligence - “We really have to settle this before Christmas to have any chance of ratification”—Brexit negotiations
summary:
Also on the daily podcast: an interfaith conspiracy theory in India and a hermit-crab housing shortage in Thailand“We really have to settle this before Christmas to have any chance of ratification”—Brexit negotiationsBRITAIN’S DIVORCE from the European Union still hinges on sticky matters of fishing rights and the enforcement of fair competition, and time is rapidly running out to strike a deal.
India’s fantastical “love jihad” conspiracy theory is just another Muslim-marginalisation move—one that the government seemingly approves of.
And a hermit-crab housing shortage in Thailand.
Runtime: 19minListen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneInFor full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here www.economist.com/intelligenceoffer
paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: an interfaith conspiracy theory in India and a hermit-crab housing shortage in Thailand
“We really have to settle this before Christmas to have any chance of ratification”—Brexit negotiations

BRITAIN’S DIVORCE from the European Union still hinges on sticky matters of fishing rights and the enforcement of fair competition, and time is rapidly running out to strike a deal. India’s fantastical “love jihad” conspiracy theory is just another Muslim-marginalisation move—one that the government seemingly approves of. And a hermit-crab housing shortage in Thailand. Runtime: 19min
Listen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneIn
For full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here www.economist.com/intelligenceoffer
